titleStmt.title: Edward D. Townsend, Special Orders, No. 256
CWG11506

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.collection: 45th, 47th, 48th, and 49th Regiments Kentucky Infantry Muster Rolls

body.p:
WAR DEPARTMENT,
ADJUTANT GENERAL'S OFFICE,
Washington, August 1st, 1864.
SPECIAL ORDERS,
No. 256
(Extract.)

46. So much of Special Orders, No. 151, June 2d, 1864, from Head-quarters, Department of the Ohio, as accepted the resignation of 1st Lieutenant George L. Lorier, 48th Kentucky Volunteers, "to enable him to accept promotion," is hereby revoked, and he is restored to his command, with pay from the date at which he rejoined his regiment for duty, provided the vacancy has not been filled, evidence of which must be obtained from the Governor.

By order of the Secretary of War:
E. D. TOWNSEND,
Assistant Adjutant General.

OFFICIAL:
E D Townsend
Assistant Adjutant General.

War Department
Adjutant Generals Office
Washington Aug. 1. 1864
Townsend E D.
A. A. G.
So much of Spe. Ord. No 151 as accepted resig: of Lt. Geo. L. Lorier 48: Ky Infy is revoked and he is restored to his command.
